intro: Heteropterys anoptera subvar. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf heteropterys, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, broad leaves that are typically palmately lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are usually pink or red, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The subvariety latifolia is distinguished by its wider leaf structure compared to other forms of Heteropterys anoptera.
